body_html:
This is not typical usage pattern from a python shell. To use an op, directly use tf.<op name>(...). To, say, use something from the training package, you can do tf.train.Saver.

If you are adding/modifying TensorFlow source code -- instead of operating from within a shell -- there's plenty of examples on how to properly import.
body_text:
This is not typical usage pattern from a python shell.  To use an op, directly use tf.<op name>(...).  To, say, use something from the training package, you can do tf.train.Saver.
If you are adding/modifying TensorFlow source code -- instead of operating from within a shell -- there's plenty of examples on how to properly import.
body:
This is not typical usage pattern from a python shell.  To use an op, directly use `tf.<op name>(...)`.  To, say, use something from the `training` package, you can do `tf.train.Saver`.

If you are adding/modifying TensorFlow source code -- instead of operating from within a shell -- there's plenty of examples on how to properly import.
